title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős-Mordell Inequality** (1935/1937):

For any interior point P of triangle ABC:

PA + PB + PC ≥ 2(PX + PY + PZ)

where X, Y, Z are feet of perpendiculars from P to the sides.

Proved by Mordell and Barrow in 1937. One of the most elegant results in plane geometry.

title: Point in ℝ²
content:
A point in the Euclidean plane, represented as `EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)`.

This is Mathlib's standard type for the Euclidean plane with norm and inner product.

title: Euclidean Distance
content:
dist(P, Q) = ‖P - Q‖, the standard Euclidean distance.

This is the metric used throughout the problem.

title: IsTriangle
content:
Three points form a **non-degenerate triangle** if they are not collinear.

This ensures ABC spans a 2-dimensional region with positive area.

title: Interior Point
content:
P is an **interior point** of triangle ABC if it lies strictly inside the convex hull.

The inequality may fail for points on the boundary or exterior.

title: Perpendicular Foot
content:
The **perpendicular foot** from P to line AB is the point X on AB closest to P.

Equivalently, X is the orthogonal projection of P onto line AB.

PX ⊥ AB at X.

title: Distance to Line
content:
The **distance from P to line AB** is dist(P, X) where X is the perpendicular foot.

This is the perpendicular distance, the shortest path from P to the line.

title: Perpendicular Feet Structure
content:
The three perpendicular feet from P to triangle ABC:

- X = foot on side BC
- Y = foot on side CA
- Z = foot on side AB

These form the **pedal triangle** XYZ.

title: Vertex Distance Sum
content:
**PA + PB + PC**: Sum of distances from P to the three vertices.

This is the left-hand side of the Erdős-Mordell inequality.

title: Side Distance Sum
content:
**PX + PY + PZ**: Sum of perpendicular distances from P to the three sides.

This is half the right-hand side of the inequality.

title: The Erdős-Mordell Inequality
content:
**PA + PB + PC ≥ 2(PX + PY + PZ)**

Vertex distances are at least twice side distances.

The constant 2 is optimal and cannot be improved.

title: The Erdős-Mordell Theorem
content:
**Theorem** (Mordell, 1937): The Erdős-Mordell inequality holds for all interior points P of any triangle ABC.

Axiomatized here; multiple elementary proofs exist.

title: Equilateral Triangle
content:
A triangle is **equilateral** if all three sides have equal length:

|AB| = |BC| = |CA|

title: Centroid
content:
The **centroid** is the center of mass: G = (A + B + C)/3.

For equilateral triangles, centroid = incenter = circumcenter.

title: Equality Condition
content:
**Equality** PA + PB + PC = 2(PX + PY + PZ) holds **if and only if**:

1. ABC is equilateral, AND
2. P is the center (centroid/incenter/circumcenter)

For any other configuration, the inequality is strict.

title: Mordell's Proof
content:
**Mordell (1937)**: First proof using trigonometric identities.

Expresses distances in terms of angles and applies AM-GM.

title: Barrow's Proof
content:
**Barrow (1937)**: Independent, more elementary proof.

Published in the American Mathematical Monthly.

title: Viviani's Theorem
content:
**Viviani's Theorem**: In an equilateral triangle, the sum of distances from any interior point to the sides equals the altitude.

PX + PY + PZ = h (constant!)

This is a beautiful invariant for equilateral triangles.

title: Main Result
content:
**Erdős Problem #898: SOLVED**

The Erdős-Mordell inequality holds:
PA + PB + PC ≥ 2(PX + PY + PZ)

Proved by Mordell in 1937, now a classic of geometric inequalities.
